title: 5.1 – Best Practice Steps to Resolve Problems
content:
🧰 Best Practice Steps to Resolve Problems

⚠️ Before You Start:
Always follow corporate policies and procedures.
Understand documentation and impact before making changes.

Step 1: Identify the Problem

  • Gather info from user – What changed? What happened?
  • Ask about updates or user actions
  • Check environmental/infrastructure factors
  • Backup data if necessary

🧠 Tip: Act like a detective.

Step 2: Establish a Theory of Probable Cause

  • Check obvious causes first (loose cable, muted speaker)
  • Use documentation, forums, internal knowledge bases

🧠 Tip: Start with simple causes.

Step 3: Test the Theory

  • If theory is confirmed → proceed to fix
  • If not → revisit theory or escalate issue

🧠 Tip: Don't assume – confirm.

Step 4: Establish a Plan of Action

  • Create steps to resolve the issue
  • Follow vendor documentation or SOPs

🧠 Tip: Have a roadmap before acting.

Step 5: Verify Full System Functionality

  • Ensure the issue is resolved
  • Test related systems
  • Apply prevention (patches, training)

🧠 Tip: Don’t just fix – future-proof.

Step 6: Document Findings, Actions, and Outcomes

  • Record what the issue was and how it was resolved
  • Log steps taken and recommendations

🧠 Tip: If it’s not documented, it didn’t happen!
